cyclone.name: GORDON
cyclone.current_location: about 130 miles SSE of Mobile, Alabama
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest toward the north-central Gulf Coast with landfall expected near the Mississippi-Alabama border, then curving north-northwest inland toward Arkansas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the mouth of the Pearl River (MS/AL border) on the north-central Gulf Coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm Surge Watch west of Shell Beach LA to the Mouth of the Mississippi River and east of Dauphin Island AL to Navarre FL
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning mouth of Pearl River to AL-FL border; Storm Surge Warning Shell Beach LA to Dauphin Island AL; Tropical Storm Warning west of Pearl River to Grand Isle LA and AL-FL border to Okaloosa-Walton Co. line
weather_observation.impacted_coast: north-central Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana through coastal Mississippi, Alabama, and the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Occasional gusts 20–30 mph possible from peripheral bands; sustained tropical-storm-force winds unlikely
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor rise possible (around 1 ft) in Sabine Pass; significant surge not expected
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of intermittent showers possible as outer rainbands brush SE Texas
weather_observation.other_hazards: None of operational significance expected at Port Arthur
